If you're a fan of the atmosphere of the original, or the aesthetic, it may well be worth checking this out for 20 or so minutes. It's not a massive download and it's free, so there's not much harm in checking it out. I found myself watching over the city for almost 40 minutes straight, as the rain and Vangelis music drew me in ever deeper. And that's considering I don't have VR anything, so it was just through my monitor screen. If I had to complain, it would be: there's not much to do (fair enough, it's a walking simulator) and the rain in particular isn't very well done visually.

블레이드 러너 9732는 블레이드 러너라는 불후의 명작 영화를 원작으로 2019년 LA의 주인공 아파트를 체험 할 수 있는 게임이다.

블레이드 러너는 필립.k.딕의 소설 <안드로이드는 전기양의 꿈을 꾸는가>를 원작으로 1982년에 명감독 리들리 스콧과 해리슨 포드를 주연으로 제작 되었으며 특징으로는 반젤리스의 명곡 그리고 환상적인 사이버펑크의 비주얼을 구현해냈다. 2017년에 35년만에 블레이드 러너 2049라는 후속작이 나왔으며 역시 불후의 명작으로 평가받는다.

도중에 영화에서 나온 장면도 그대로 체험할 수 있기에 원작 영화를 보고나서 체험 하길 추천

39439860.review:
[quote=][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/12146432-La-Cruceta-Inquieta/][b]La Cruceta Inquieta[/b][/url], mentor de Steam[/quote]

Tengo que comenzar expresando mi personal agradecimiento a su desarrollador, Quentin Lengele, por hacer realidad, aún siendo a pequeña escala, parte del sueño que creo que muchos fans de la película original de Ridley Scott y que al mismo tiempo somos videojugadores estábamos esperando. 

Blade Runner 9732 representa con enorme fidelidad el apartamento del mismo número propiedad de Rick Deckard y basado en elementos de la Ennis House de Frank Lloyd Wright. Desde el primer momento en que se sale del ascensor nos envolverá un ambiente prácticamente idéntico al de la película, pasando de la luminosidad artificial del pasillo distribuidor a la penumbra depresiva reinante en el interior del apartamento de Deckard. Por el camino podremos interactuar con ciertos elementos (pocos en la actualidad pero parece que la intención es llevar a cabo actualizaciones futuras) presentes también en escenas memorables de la película y que al final nos llevarán a salir de nuevo a un exterior donde la música original de Vangelis, la luz y el ambiente decadente de la L.A. ficticia de 2019 revivirán sin remedio todos los recuerdos y sensaciones que pudimos experimentar durante la película.

Personalmente no he podido probar la opción de realidad virtual, pero imagino que conllevará un nuevo nivel de inmersión para poder disfrutar aún más, si cabe, de este pequeño homenaje a Blade Runner.

Blade Runner 9732 es, definitivamente, una experiencia casi impagable que, pese a su sencillez (no deja de ser un "walking simulator" o tour virtual), ha de ser probada por cualquier fan de la película original de 1982. Ojalá algún día podamos tener un juego completo fiel a ella.

Blade-Runner 9732 ist eine tolle Cyberpunk-Experience, die dich gut in diese eigenartige Welt versetzt. Insbesondere in Deckard`s Apartement.  
 Überall liegen hier Zigarettenstummel und interessant aussehende Dokumente herum. Kuriose Tech steht inmitten einem chaotischen Raum voll mit Büchern, die wie Dinge aus einer vergessenden Zeit anmuten. 
 Die Grafik ist exelent und  der Moment indem man auf den Balkon hinausgeht und die vorbeifahrenden Autos in den Straßen unten und in der Luft sieht, der Dauerregen der niederprasselt und die schrillen Werbetafeln bemerkt ist wirklich cool.
Leider sind die Interaktionsmöglichkeiten auf Aufsammeln von Flaschen und Gläsern beschränkt und die Bewegung ist etwas kurios, aber alles in allem eine tolle Erfahrung. Sollte man spielen, wenn man Blade-Runner oder Cyberpunk mag. Für alle anderen ist es auch ein Blick wert, es ist ja umsonst.

39286186.review:
Highly-detailed, wonderfully atmospheric and joyously nostalgic labour of love. Obviously some artistic license had been used to fill in the gaps, but BR9732 really nails the noirish retrofuture vibe of Deckard's gloomy, rundown apartment and the overall ambiance of Ridley Scott's 1982 sci-fi classic. Quite simply, it looks stunning and it's a fabulous, albeit relatively short, exploration experience. No fan should miss this.

You don't need a VR headset, but this makes me wish I had one. I'd love to see more locations added, but no doubt that would be a tonne of extra work.

VR needs more small labors of love like this.  It's an unambitious little personal project, but over time I think there will be many of these and they will amount to much collectively.  The ability to visit beloved fictional places in well-crafted detail for no other reason than just the experience of "being" there.

My only criticism is there should be some graphics options to cancel some of the more demanding effects.  There's a lot of set pieces with complicated lighting effects going on that absolutely killed my computer.  My rig isn't amazing, but it's good enough that I haven't had issues with most VR stuff I've tried.  I had to avoid certain spots in this, because looking at them would tank my performance.  Just giving me a menu to tone down some bloom and shadows would go a long way on this point, I think.

This is not a game. It is a VR work of art!

Out of all the VR Environments I've subscribed to on Steam, this one was hiding in the "VR Games" section, tucked away and out of sight. While you *can* view this without VR, this is a *must* download for anyone who has a headset and loves Blade Runner. You'll kick yourself for not checking this out. This is not a cheap, quickly thrown together attempt at Deckard's apartment. This is a loving recreation that will give you chills. 

Thank you Quentin for taking the time to build this. 

I expected to spend 5 minutes here like every other environment I've ever downloaded. I spent 50 minutes and couldn't rip myself away from it, despite having exploring every inch. I know I'll be back, and I'll show every visitor who puts on my headset this apartment as a representation of where VR is headed...

Touching the piano keys...
Pouring a drink...
Closing the shades...
Analyzing the photo... (while sitting in an accurate chair location!)
Listening to the pot boil...
Reading the papers...
Soaking in the rain from the balcony...

It was emotional and impactful. 

BRAVO... 

If you build more... I'll be there!

39227129.review:
PLEASE UNDERSTAND THAT THIS IS A TECH DEMO!

People seem to think this is a game of some sort, but it isn't. It's a tech demo; there's very little to "play" here, as it's mostly an environment recreation.

I'm going to be brutally honest: this really needs some more work. It's OK for what it is and it recreates some of the atmosphere, but there are a number of glaring issues with the demo:
- The grain filter needs serious toning down
- The DoF option needs serious toning down and improving (people's vision really isn't THAT bad ;) ) and needs to be more accurate in terms of focus points. It takes away from the realism rather than adding to it by making hidden surfaces trigger it.
- The rendering jerks and stutters; most likely due to using oversized textures
- The one interactable object in the apartment (a media station) makes the demo crash the moment interaction is attempted. Please fix!
- As some other people intimately familiar with BladeRunner have remarked: if an accurate recreation was attempted, then it failed. If this was just meant to be a tech demo, then great!
- It's a single apartment and some surrounding environment of the city and building. Despite this limited environment, it's a Gigabyte download -- that seems rather excessive.

Even though this is free, and clearly a lot of work has gone in it to gather all the media and designing the environment, in its current state I have to give it a thumbs down. Maybe when v2.0 is out, it'll have ironed out most of these issues and it can shine, but right now it's too broken and incomplete to get my recommendation.

39224588.review:
I think it's an absolute insane irony that Blade Runner 9732 is a virtual reality experience in 2018 about a science fiction movie that predicted what the world would be like in 2018. The film was incorrect in its prognostications, but like most things in history, the truth is stranger than fiction. We don't have spinners(flying cars) or replicants(human-like robots) YET, but VR is something not even the movie had the wherewithall to predict, but it's just as strange as either.

Not even Philip K. Dick, the author of the book on which Blade Runner was based, could've predicted that human beings in 2018 would be experiencing new worlds in virtual reality, but almost 40 years after the movie came out, I'm walking around in my VR play-space, completely transported to the world of Rick Deckard, exploring a room I've seen countless times in my endless screenings of Ridley Scott's sci-fi epic.

Standing on the balcony of Deckard's apartment, with my gun, a bottle of liquor and an empty glass on the balcony ledge as I looked out over a smog-infested and rain-soaked 2019 Los Angeles, with Vangelis's haunting score setting the mood is something I literally could not have imagined I'd be doing when I first discovered the movie in the mid-80s as a kid.

What a strange, awesome time we live in. Kudos to the dev for this masterwork of awe-inspiring presence.

39220723.review:
Even as a non-VR player of this, the "game" is pretty cool.

You can tell that the developer has spent a lot of time researching one of cinema's most elusive, yet famous sets-- Rick Deckard's apartment featured in the 1982 proto-cyberpunk magnum opus, Blade Runner. To say that this is anything short of a fanboy's dream come true does no favors for BR9732. 

This experience (because I don't feel comfortable calling it a game,) is pretty awesome. You start out in the elevator of Deckard's apartment, and you can walk through the hallway to his front door. Once inside you are free to do as you wish, such as interact with various items in his apartment, or explore the bulk of it.

This is an unfinished build in the developer's own admission, and at some parts it is obvious-- there is no unicorn origami in the hallway floor left by Gaff (depending on which cut of the film you watch,) there are placeholder items such as magazines and cans of Axe deodorant body spray. In other sequences it feels flawless and finite, such as the sample of music Rachael performed at the piano for Deckard while he dreamt.

I am not one to nitpick, but being such a die-hard fan of Blade Runner does make it a bit difficult to oversee some of the flaws, as they remove the player's immersion factor significantly. Another absentee is one of the film's most famous elements-- Sean Young in her breakthrough performance as the Nexus 7 replicant, Rachael. I have followed the developer's blog for quite some time, and I have seen the renders of Rachael. They're quite impressive, so here's hoping she debuts in a future build of this. 

My biggest complaint was the lack of interactivity within the apartment, though by the developer's own admission, it seems like object interaction will be included at a future date. It felt like a slightly guided tour of Deckard's apartment.

With those shortcomings aside, it becomes easy to point out the areas in which BR9732 succeeds. First of all, recreating Deckard's apartment in 1:1 scale digitally is no short task. If you spend more than a few minutes on the internet, you will find that resources on the original Blade Runner are incredibly difficult to come across. Some of the best ways to gain information on the film's production are through out-of-print hardcovers and the anniversary Blu-Ray discs. Considering these factors, it is mind-blowing the level of detail the developer was able to conjure from seemingly thin air, crafting a near-perfect replica of an iconic movie set.

Another area I'd like to commend is the sound design. From the ambient noise, to the music on the balcony, to the authentic sound effects in every room, it is clear that no expense was spared in recreating the apartment. 

The biggest thing that impressed me was standing in front of Deckard's balcony, glass of Johnnie Walker on the ledge, with Vangelis' "Blade Runner Blues" playing on a loop. You assimilate the depression, desperation, and bleak curiosity of the broken detective and it feels like a noir film.

All in all, this could use some polish, but represents an incredible fan creation and landmark digital media from a franchise not known for being prolific.

39216524.review:
[h1]Blade Runner 9732[/h1]


Ohhhh.... ein Blade Runner... dachte ich mir... ohhhh... ein VR-Game... dachte ich mir... ohhh... doch nicht... Aber es waren doch 20 Minuten, in denen ich etwas gesehen habe. Es ist zwar kein richtiges Spiel, aber man kann sich ein paar Minuten, besonders als Fan, oder jemand der zumindest mal nichts zu tun hat mal anschauen. Warum man das vielleicht tun kann oder vielleicht auch sollte? Es hat sich ein wenig gelohnt und es ist kostenlos. Es ist nichts berauschendes, aber der Sound mit Headset ist wirklich extrem gut. Ein wenig Zeit zum Träumen...

[b]Pro:[/b]
+ kostenlos
+ Sound ist mit Sourround echt wunderbar
+ Blade Runner feeling
+ man braucht keine VR Brille, um sich alles anzuschauen
+ relativ flüssig...

[b]Contra:[/b]
- doch sehr miese FPS für die Hardware die ich einsetze
- Framerate auf konstanten 30fps (schwankt ab und zu auf 60-70 nach oben)
- Grafik allgemein ist nichts super neues
- nur ganz wenige Aktionen, die man tätigen kann
- viel zu kurz, habe zumindest mehr erwartet
- und ganz ehrlich, warum kein Spiegelbild oder das man Füße oder so sehen kann


[b]Fazit:[/b]
Netter Zeitvertreib und das war es auch schon. Auch wenn ich viele negative Punkte aufgeschrieben habe, gebe ich wie bei allen kostenlosen Spielen, Tech Demos und so weiter (die jetzt nicht internes bezahlen und so weiter haben - Ihr wisst wovon ich rede!) immer eine positive Bewertung. Es hat zwar keinen weiteren Sinn, aber der Entwickler hat sich mühe gegeben. Dem einen gefällt es mehr, dem anderem weniger. Es kostet nichts, es führt einen in die Vergangenheit, Blade Runner!, was will man für ein wenig Zeit, die Ihr sowieso für teilweise andere Dinge sinnloser verstreichen lasst, ohne etwas Geld zu investieren, erwarten. Daher Daumen hoch und geniesst den Ausblick.

39193707.review:
[b]Blade Runner 9732 4/5:[/b] Konečně definitivní odpověď na ONU otázku... Ano, Deckard je replikant. Protože jako "opravdová" bytost by doma nemohl mít cca patnáct flašek stejného alkoholu vypitých na kapku stejnou hladinku, pět kartonů mléka či ty samé neosobní vázy, knihy z 19. století, lejstra a především fota (samozřejmě shodná) z klasických noir žánrovek v každé jedné místnosti a na každém druhém stolku.

 Ovšem vážně, tohle je ultimátní atmosferická pocta od fanouška pro fanoušky. Největší škoda je tak neinteraktivity; speciálně když vás těch několik málo interaktivních bodů namlsá, jaké to mohlo být, kdyby šlo zapínat/vypínat/otevírat/vzít/číst každou jednu věc nebo umývat nádobí. Stačí však vylézt na balkon, nechat rozeznít Vangelisův soundtrack a... A jste tam, ne že ne. Což mě přivádí k tomu, že jsem výše kecal. Největší škoda není neinteraktivity, ale že nemůžete sjet výtahem dolů, projít hlavním vchodem a vyrazit do širého noirového světa.

 Ano, je to "pouze" gratis walking simulator po bytě 3+1 na minutu (či jste-li runnerovští fanatici, tak klidně zbytek života), ale atmosférou dýchá každou jednu vteřinu. A to i bez VR; což teprve s ním. Navíc to nic nemění na tom, že i tak jde o nejlepší titul z tohoto universa za posledních jednadvacet let, jakkoli neoficiální.

39182915.review:
Well... Its  free, so you can give it a try, just dont expect much!

You can walk around the house, looks outside, its a 5minutes walk simulator, or should I say, a "Tour-Game", The graphics are nice, and the atmopshere is really  good, BUT:

* There is an extremely intensive Film-Grain that can NOT be turned off, even Walking Dead has less extreme film-grain

* Also very extreme lens-flare that can't be turned off/tuned down

* Also very extreme mouse smoothing that can NOT be turnet off/tuned down 

* No option to change mouse sensitivity

* Limited key rebinding with several keys hardcoded

* VERY inconsistent(aka terrible) frame-pacing and many times the game looks like it is running at 25-30fps, when in fact(confirmed by both in-game fps counter and Rivatuner) that the frame-rate is locked at refresh rate. The issue remains with and without V-Sync.



I liked this 5minutes tour, and the atmosphere is very good, but it has too many issues and limits, but nothing that a patch can not fix.

4/10

Виртуальный мини-тур по апартаментам Рика Декарда, героя киноленты "Бегущий по лезвию". 

Милый фанфик для поклонников фильма, но не более: графика угловатая и не технологичная, однотипные текстуры, слишком много тёмных мест и не до конца продуманный дизайн с множеством пустот в тех местах, где напрашиваются те или иные декоративные элементы. Слабоватый саунд-дизайн: звуки зациклены слишком явно, не хватает эмбиенса в самой квартире и прочих атмосфер/дронов. Видны старания, но автор не знает, как удержать внимание: мелодия на фортепиано могла бы быть более продолжительной, не хватает радио (может быть на кухне?), телевизора, музыкального проигрывателя и подобных мелочей, мало книг и других объектов, нет интерактивности (кроме открывания и закрывания шторок). 

В этом смысле хороший ориентир - Deus Ex: Mankind Divided, но судя по всему, автор проекта эту игру внимательно изучал, просто не имеет финансовой возможности подобраться к её технологическому уровню. Однако все недоделки уходят на второй план, когда выбираешься на балкон, где под шум дождя начинает играть культовая 'Blade Runner Blues' Вангелиса - в такие моменты понимаешь, что киберпанк жив, пускай и стараниями энтузиастов.

8 января 2018. Проект пребывает в стадии беты, тестировался без VR.

39171783.review:
I rarely leave a negative review--and never before for a free title--but I found this extremely underwhelming.  This title has no substance whatsoever.  It has all the makings of something interesting--music by Vangelis, the Blade Runner cityscape, a neo-noir atmosphere.  But there is literally [b]nothing[/b] to do.  And to make matters worse, it teases you with meaningless interactivity (e.g. you can pick up drinking glasses or even a gun) but you can't do anything with them.  And even holding them requires you keep pressing the side button on the Vive wand controller.  

Some might argue I am being too harsh--after all, this is a demo, not a game.  That's true, but it's still a boring demo.  The developers could have made other choices--a large number of demos do have some type of game mechanic.  They give you a flashlight and a gun--why not have you search the apartment for some files?  The developers also might have chosen a Walking Simulator mechanic providing some type of narrative or context.  Nope--you're just in an apartment.  

There is a lot of graphical attention to detail.  Of course the developers have ample material from the film(s) from which to lift.  I don't deny that this title looks good in VR.  The cityscape is especially well rendered.  Despite looking good the experience is still disposable and forgettable--and that is disappointing given the compelling source material.

Honestly, it wouldn't surprise me whatsoever if this demo was largely produced as a commercial not only for the film but also because of the product placement.

Here's the botton line:  it's a free title so just download it and try it and form your own opinion.  It has great music and maybe you'll find the apartment kind of neat.  Just don't expect anything.  You'll look at some pretty visuals for a few minutes and forget this title and delete it from your hard-drive immediately thereafter.

39169280.review:
[H1] Playes this on the Oculus Rift with Touch Controllers without any issues [/H1]

I get that this game is free and this is a passion project from the developer.  Obviously, there are some legal issues here and the dev took some chances to bring us this experience and I can appreciate all that.  I even like Blade Runner, although, by reading the reviews, I'm not a diehard fan or a fanboy.  

However, when I rate games I always ask myself is this game fun for me?  And would I recommend this game to certain friends or family (especially kids who might have different things that appeal to them)?  In this case, the answer is no to just about anyone.  In fact, I think the only people who would enjoy this experience are Blade Runner fanboys.

It's a nice environment.  It has lots of details in it.  Definitely, standing in the rain and watching the city go by has its momentary appeal.  But that's not enough to recommend the game.  There's almost no interaction in this game or experience.  Nothing happens.  You can get the piano to play a quick tune.  You can get the Esper machine to play a quick video.  You can open and close blinds.  You can pick up whisky bottles and glasses.  

But you can't pour it.  You can't drink it.  You can't even pick up the lit cigarettes.  The mirrors don't work.  You can only open one door.  By open I mean teleport in the apartment after grabbing the handle.  You can't grab most objects.  Even those you can, the physics are all wrong.  You teleport around, certain places are out of bounds.

Even the rain doesn't look right.  The traffic doesn't look right.  Are those cars?  That cop car just loops.  Everything is a loop outside.  A very short loop.  You can grab and fire a gun.  But nothing happens.  I shot at the cop.  Nothing.  

Nothing is this game.  Nothing is this experience.  All fan service.  I appreciate what the developer did.  It's a labor of love.  But if your'e not a diehard fan, it's not worth the download.  I can't recommend this game other than to Blade Runner fanboys.

Rating 4/10

39167102.review:
First things first: I have been in love with this movie since I first saw it. I loved 2049, but it lacks the "noir" essence that its predecesor has. I am an inconditional fan of the original movie, and I have to say you sir, the creator of this awesome masterpiece of VR, are just as amazing as this movie is.

BR: 9732 is a perfect recreation of Deckard's apartament as it was pictured in the original Blade Runner movie. I think it is not fair to call it a "Walking Simulator", because it is more like a "VR experience". It features a truly unique set of original sounds, effects, music and props that will make you amazed at how much effort and love has been put to this virtual experience. From the illumination to the rain over the streets, you can feel the dark, noir atmosphere that was featured on 1982's cult movie.

You want to check your ESPER machine to review an overlooked crive scene? Just turn it on and hear the original dialogue.
Maybe you are in the mood for shooting with your official LAPD 2019 Blaster. Just take it and pull the trigger to release some steam!
Damn, you can really (and I mean, REALLY) play the piano on Deckards apartament, as every single key features its own sound.
Or my favourite part, you can just walk to the balcony and watch a true, living representation of LA as it was pictured in the movie, complete with japanese ads and flying cop cars.

Everything for the absurd price of... zero pennies, because it is completely free.

If you are a diehard fan of the movie, you will absolutely love this. Give it a shot and enjoy a well deserved day off from hunting down those Nexus 6 Replicants.

P.S: If the author reads this, you totally should make a version of this jewel as a SteamVR Home environment. It would be amazing to have your own Blade Runner Appartament as a starting point for VR experiences!

39161498.review:
Nicely done - Recommended even on a low end system! The ambience really shines with the “Volumetric Lights” enabled.

Tip: Once in VR mode, before using the gun to start the experience, hit ESC right away and configure the settings from your monitor to adjust fidelity in VR before proceeding otherwise you will start in the “Fantastic” graphite mode and likely really low frame rates. Enable “Volumetric Lightning” for a better experience.

Notes: As of writing, “Dept of Field” seems to cause major blur in VR mode and visual artefacts in 3D mode and should likely be disabled if you experience these symptoms.

Also noticed that the game doesn't always keep the settings and if launching VR mode after the game is started the settings need to be readjusted so doing so before using the gun to start the experience is recommended.


Experienced on: Oculus Rift with Touch on Windows 10 64-bit using Intel i7-960 paired with 12GB RAM and a pair of 780 GTX (only one enabled by default in this game) in a 2.1 x 2.0 M (about 7 x 7 foot) room setup. 

On this older system I was able to use 1920X1080 resolution in the “Fastest” mode without hiccups and the fidelity in the “Fastest” mode is still good.


To the DEV: Other than minor visual glitches (scaling is sightly off – the size of the coffee machine in particular was weird) the walking mechanics caught me off-guard when I started walking thought the bed. As a side note I am also not sure how the walking animation is triggered.

Also noticed that the sound of the gun was really loud which is expected but did not depend on where it was placed in the environment. The volumetric Lightning also did not seem to change when closing the blinds of the windows.

P.S. Tried it with better settings in 3d mode and I can't wait for 4K headsets to become mainstream in a few years.

As a long-time fan of the original Bladerunner, I gotta tell you this is one of the best looking VR experiences out there right now.

If you love cyberpunk themed games and have a VR headset, it's free and it's definitely a neat idea.

And even though there isn't *OFFICIAL* oculus rift support, it works pretty well, although you might have to be careful looking away from the trackers if you only have 2, as it's a 3D room-scale game and you could get syncing issues.

That being said, I feel that there's more to be explored in the tour itself, as it mainly consists of you looking around, picking up liquor bottles, axe body spray, and l'oreal shampoo (why), and playing out key scenes of the original movie (Which don't pan out as well as I had hoped [spoiler]No actual hard copy that you can pick up[/spoiler] ).

It also doesn't have much music even though it boasts about it.  Walking in and around the apartment, it's all ambient sounds.  Don't get me wrong, there's appreciation for that as well, but if you saying there's vangelis ambient music, gimme vangelis ambient music, not just a [spoiler]real time balcony scene[/spoiler] .

Other than that, It's neat, and definitely worth a half hour of your time if you enjoy the movies, with vr or not.  It's free, who am I kidding.

39157466.review:
I played this with an Oculus Rift, which was unfortunately not the best experience due to bad judder (the game is labeled to be Vive-only, and I'm guessing that's the reason for the issue). But the environment is absolutely gorgeous, and there were some really nice touches; the creators of this experience really put a lot of detail and care into the environment.

The one thing that threw me off was that when  you locomote, it switches between teleportation and walking pretty arbitrarily; I'm not sure which one will occur when I initiate a movement, and the sudden change in movement type was distracting each time. I would recommend that the devs choose one or the other in order to maximize immersion.

Over all this is a beautiful environment to explore, very meditative and peaceful, and has some wonderful details that will please Blade Runner fans.

39490887.review:
This is a fantastic achievement.  If you like the Aesthetics of Bladerunner or are a fan of the film is a wonderful area to explore.  There are two things in here though that are probably worth experiencing even if you're not.  The balcony and the rain is rather relaxing, and being able to actually play the pian is really enjoyable.

I swear I could smell the dinner cooking in the kitchen too, until I realised that I was actually cooking dinner before I started.  Thankfully it wasn't burnt!

Some of the furniture seemed a tad wide, but I feel that way in almost every VR experience.  The height seemed just grand though.  

I do hope Rachel gets added, and a bit more interactivity.  I'd be happy to pay for the pleasure.

P.S. You can teleport off the balcony to the lip in front of the window to your left for a nice drop of vertigo.  Also works just fine on the Rift, booted in Steam VR mode showing Rift controllers.  One of the face buttons gives an accurate help display.
